topic.title: Gray Window on Linux With the Compiz / Beryl Window Manager

section.title: Problem
section.p: I try to run on Linux with the Compiz / Beryl window manager but I get only a gray window that does not respond to user actions. Sometimes the window responds to user actions but after opening and closing an dialog or after resizing the window or a view of the window the content of this window becomes gray and it does not respond to user actions. What is wrong?

section.title: Solution
section.p: Sun Microsystems' Java virtual machine does not support the Compiz window manager and the Beryl one very well. It is expected that better support for Compiz / Beryl will be added in future versions of their Java virtual machine. You should turn off the special effects of the Compiz / Beryl window manager before starting the application or switch to other window manager.
